channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI billionaire Sam Altman lists stunning 22-acre Hawaii property for $49 million
item.description: Altman is selling the property just 18 months after he wed his longtime partner, Oliver Mulherin, on the grounds of the estate.

item.title: ‘I spend 5 hours a day on my portfolio’: I’m 70 and received $300K in a lawsuit. What do you think of my investment plan?
item.description: “It’s important to find a way to manage your emotions to prevent them from damaging your financial and personal future.”

item.title: China finds Nvidia broke antitrust law and extends probe. Shares are dropping.
Hulk Hogan’s daughter removed from his will—who gets his $11 million Florida home?
item.description: The future of the late wrestler’s mansion may be in doubt as his will shines a light on a bitter family rift.

item.title: My boyfriend, 69, moved in. He refuses to pay more than $1,300 in rent and won’t do yard work. What should I do?
item.description: “It’s clear that he seems to think that if I die, that he should inherit the house. That is NOT my plan.”

item.title: AI monetization is spreading. UBS shares some of its favorite China plays
item.description: Several mainland companies have had a chance at monetizing generative AI in the past two years. Leaders and laggards are emerging.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts bet on the potential of these 3 stocks for the long haul
item.description: TipRanks' ranking service discusses three stocks, including Broadcom and Oracle, that are favored by Wall Street.

item.title: Wall Street’s SPAC engine restarts as deal volume hits post-2021 high
item.description: So far this year, 89 SPACs have launched IPOs, the busiest pace since 2021, according to data from SPACInsider.

item.title: An AI ‘house of cards’: Worries of a bubble grow after Oracle’s rally on OpenAI deal
item.description: OpenAI needs more than $300 billion in revenue to "justify" its level of spending, one analyst said.

item.title: Tesla and Micron are overbought and could be due for a pullback with stock market at all-time high
item.description: The stock market's run to fresh all-time highs this week has left some individual names in overbought territory, putting them at risk of a pullback.
